prior_accusations.context: Executed as witch on same day Hellenix heard about salt left at Aultrepierre
Only time openly accused before trial, but he was dead drunk

notable_quotes.speaker: Didier de Dompierre (dying husband)
notable_quotes.french: qu'on l'avoit pensée faire aveugle, mais que n'y ayant sceu advenir on l'avoit attrappé par autre moyen
notable_quotes.english: they had tried to make him blind, but not succeeding had caught him by other means
notable_quotes.context: Consulted healer le Blanc Gregoire de Marienviller about his illness

notable_quotes.speaker: Hellenix le Reytre
notable_quotes.french: elle avoit desja heu cinq proces et les avoit tous gagné, Qu'elle seroit encore bien aysé d'en avoir ung autre pour y faire conformer quelques personnes jusques a leurs chemises
notable_quotes.english: she had already had five lawsuits and won them all, that she would be very happy to have another one to make some people conform down to their shirts
notable_quotes.context: Standing in front of her lodgings, threatening litigation

notable_quotes.speaker: Hellenix le Reytre to Nicolas de Lency
notable_quotes.context: Angry when Jean Danjou brought back salt from Aultrepierre

notable_quotes.speaker: Hellenix le Reytre about Jean Danjou
notable_quotes.french: fault-il que par eulx je perde tout mon bien... Juroit et affirmoit par la Mere dieu qu'elle les feroit aussi sec, que le corps d'un trepassé, et les rendoit en tel estat qu'ils n'auroient la force de monter le soeuillet de la porte de leur logis
notable_quotes.english: must I lose all my goods because of them... swore and affirmed by Mother of God that she would make them as dry as the body of a dead person, and reduce them to such a state that they would not have the strength to climb the threshold of their door
notable_quotes.context: Returned home in rage after Nicolas de Lezey was 'reprins' by Jean Danjou

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudatte femme François Pelletier
notable_quotes.context: Hellenix called the daughter this for not asking father to send money owed

notable_quotes.speaker: Hellenix le Reytre
notable_quotes.french: comment il se falloit confesser, et que l'on disoit qu'il falloit confesser tous les maulx que l'on avoit faict
notable_quotes.english: how one should confess, and that it was said one must confess all the evils one had done
notable_quotes.context: Asked witness Didier femme Chrestine du Prey about confession

notable_quotes.speaker: Didier femme Chrestine du Prey
notable_quotes.french: Tante Hellenix, vous le scavez bien, vous l'avez ouy dire a Monsieur Mabriat, il est vray qu'il fault confesser tout ce que l'on a faict
notable_quotes.english: Aunt Hellenix, you know well, you heard Monsieur Mabriat say it, it is true that one must confess all that one has done
notable_quotes.context: Response to Hellenix's question about confession

notable_quotes.speaker: Wife of Nicolas Collon
notable_quotes.french: elle estoit sy fiere et d'une tel mauvais courage que son mary et sa mere ne pouvoient compatir avec elle, et qu'il n'y avoit rien pire pour faire perdre le lait a une femme
notable_quotes.english: she was so proud and of such bad temper that her husband and mother could not get along with her, and there was nothing worse for making a woman lose her milk
notable_quotes.context: Hellenix's defense - blaming the woman's temperament for losing milk, claimed her mother was a midwife who told her this

relationships.evidence_text: Hellenix femme Barthelemin le Reytre
father was Jean de Colbay
mother Didiere
marriage to Colin Courtot of Blamont, captured and killed by passing soldiers 18 months later
remarried with Didier Roy jeune. This marriage lasted 20 years, then she was widow for 7 years
one brother, Jean de Gournay, executed as witch at Migneville 37 years before
4 sisters. Mengeotte, whose second husband was vigneron of Lunéville, had been imprisoned there as witch
Second, Allison, married to Henry Masson of Autrepierre, was executed there as a witch
third, Jehenne, who was executed at Migneville
fourth, Didier femme Didier Aulbry of Autrepierre
brother-in-law Henry Masson of Audepierre, sister Allison married to Henry Masson
son-in-law (Nicolas de Lency) was fermier of magasin de sel
Zabillon veuve Didier de Dompierre
Never visited during illness, although she was nearest neighbour
Barbe femme Jean de Prey
Philippe femme d'honnorable Didier George, maitre echevin de la justice de Blamont
Hellenix, who was renting one of her husband's houses in Blamont
Annon femme Adam de Mouney
Claudon femme Claudon le Cerf, wife of witness 1
Jennon femme Jean Diez
Zabel femme Nicolas Colon, wife of witness 2

economic_context.details: Hellenix was a 'remanderesse' (reseller). Multiple disputes centered on her son-in-law Nicolas de Lency's role as fermier of magasin à sel (salt warehouse manager). Debts owed to her (29 gros from Jehenne Gabriel, 10 gros from François Pelletier). She bought old items to resell (bought old 'paume'). Property disputes with François Pelletier over repair costs. She rented property from Didier George. Multiple witnesses were bourgeois (prosperous merchants/citizens). Fled to St Avol and gave nephew procuration to sell property in Blamont. Economic hardship evident in confession - lamented having only 3 deniers in purse when seduced.

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Wife of Nicolas Collon was so proud and bad-tempered that husband and mother couldn't get along with her - bad temper causes loss of milk (mother was midwife)
Claimed she was present when Didier de Dompierre received last rites (contradicting claim she never visited)
Claimed illness was result of being beaten by Henry Chrestian and one of his sons
When went to house and threatened action, charges were withdrawn

extraction_metadata.notes: Very comprehensive trial record with 22 witnesses spanning nearly 2 years (1606-1608). Extensive documentation of quarrels over salt warehouse management involving son-in-law Nicolas de Lency. Remarkable family history - brother and all 4 sisters either executed or imprisoned as witches. Multiple instances of loss of milk in nursing women. Many deaths of children following quarrels. Fled to St Avol using false name. Confession obtained under torture including thumbscrews. Pattern of threats followed by illness/death, particularly children. Notable that some victims recovered after Hellenix intervened (suggesting healing powers). Strong economic dimension with debts, property disputes, and occupation as remanderesse (reseller).
